availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Newport, Kentucky, attorney. Virginia native. Married to Mary A. Munday Hawkins on November 27, 1854. Father of Jane Hawkins, Richard B. Hawkins, Elva Hawkins, Edward W. Hawkins, Mary Hawkins, and Laura Hawkins. Attorney in Gallatin County in 1850. Attorney in Newport, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Gallatin County, p. 154. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 240. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Campbell County, Newport, p. 346. Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 462. Kentucky Marriage Records, 1852-1914, Ancestry, Marriages, Owen County, Kentucky, 1855. Find A Grave, "Edmund W. Hawkins (1815-1909)," Memorial #106123793, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/106123793/edmund-w.-hawkins (accessed April 17, 2017). KYR-0001-029-0592.
